title: Smiley Snake
subtitle: An emoji twist on an old classic
description: It's snake! But weirder and with emojis! Right and Left arrow keys to move. Eat faces to grow and fruit for points. Skulls, bombs, and poops are bad to eat. As in real life. Learned Phaser.js framework to make the game logic magic happen.

title: Zamenboto Slackbot
subtitle: Chuck Norris jokes on Slack in Esperanto
description: Cxu vi sciis, ke mi povas paroli esperanton? Over winter break, I wrote a slack bot that hangs out in #general in an Esperanto Learners slack. Whenever a user mentions it by name or mentions Zamenhoff (inventor of Esperanto), it responds with a Chuck Norris joke selected randomly from a sqlite database populated by calls to the Chuck Norris API. Because that's a thing. Thanks, Internet!

title: Portfolio
subtitle: You're lookin' at it!
description: My portfolio and resume are both JSON files that are consumed by an Angular.js front end. Pipeline managed by gulp. Lookit that gif, man. That's RECURSION.

title: Mantra
subtitle: yoga sequencing app
description: Build and save yoga sequnces! Drag-n-drop functionality thanks to jQuery and Dragula. Opted to deploy front end separate from backend, which turned into a remote yoga pose API.

title: MEAN tea
subtitle: Shopping cart app
description: Awww, my very first Single Page App, and my first Angular project. More of a demo than a complete project. (Had to move on to other projects before I could make it pretty.) But learned a ton of Angular. Wrote custom directives and filters, controllers and services, and routes.
